shortdesc.ph: Sets the audio attenuation effect for the specified user.
Sets the audio attenuation effect for the specified user.
Sets the sound attenuation effect for a specified user.
Sets the sound attenuation effect for a specified user.

p.codeblock: Future<void> setRemoteAudioAttenuation( {required int uid, required double attenuation, required bool forceSet});
public abstract int SetRemoteAudioAttenuation(uint uid, double attenuation, bool forceSet);

plentry.pd: User ID. Must be the same as the user ID used when joining the channel.
The audio attenuation coefficient for the user, ranging from [0,1].

Whether to force the audio attenuation effect for the user:
: Forces the use of attenuation to set the user's audio attenuation effect. In this case, the audioAttenuation set in does not apply to the user.
: Does not force the use of attenuation to set the user's audio attenuation effect. There are two cases:
If the sound source and listener are inside and outside the sound insulation zone respectively, the attenuation effect is determined by audioAttenuation in .
If the sound source and listener are both inside the same sound insulation zone or both outside, the attenuation effect is determined by attenuation in this method.
User ID. Must be the same as the user ID used when joining the channel.
The audio attenuation coefficient for the user. The range is [0,1].

Whether to force the audio attenuation effect for the user:
: Forces the use of attenuation to set the user's audio attenuation effect. In this case, the audioAttenuation set in does not take effect for this user.
: Does not force the use of attenuation to set the user's audio attenuation effect. There are two cases:
If the audio source and listener are inside and outside the sound insulation zone respectively, the attenuation effect is determined by audioAttenuation in .
If the audio source and listener are both inside the same sound insulation zone or both outside, the attenuation effect is determined by attenuation in this method.
User ID. Must match the user ID used when joining the channel.
The sound attenuation coefficient for the specified user, ranging from [0,1].

Whether to forcibly apply the sound attenuation effect for the user:
: Forces the use of attenuation to set the user's sound attenuation effect. In this case, the audioAttenuation value set in has no effect on this user.
: Does not forcibly apply attenuation to the user. Behavior depends on the following:
If the audio source and listener are in and out of the sound insulation zone respectively, the attenuation effect is determined by audioAttenuation in .
If the audio source and listener are both inside or both outside the same sound insulation zone, the attenuation effect is determined by the attenuation parameter in this method.
User ID. Must match the user ID used when joining the channel.
Sound attenuation coefficient for the specified user, value range [0,1].

Whether to forcefully apply the sound attenuation effect for the user:
: Forcefully use attenuation to set the user's sound attenuation effect. In this case, the audioAttenuation coefficient set in does not apply to the user.
: Do not forcefully use attenuation to set the user's sound attenuation effect. There are two cases:
If the sound source and listener are inside and outside the isolation zone respectively, the sound attenuation effect is determined by the audioAttenuation in .
If the sound source and listener are both inside the same isolation zone or both outside, the sound attenuation effect is determined by the attenuation in this method.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when it fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
